div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1929 Taranto ("Molossian Find"), Cala- (1058) bria, 1925 Burial: c. 334 B.C. (Vlasto) Contents: 17+ AR. Part of hoard? Taras: 3 st. (to Per. IV, A1) Heracleia: 3 st. Metapontum: 4 st. Thorium: 2 st. Velia: 2 st. Caulonia: 1 st. Alexander, son of Neoptolemus: 2 didr. Disposition: Vlasto 4 (Cat. 279, 502, 1868- 9); Lloyd 3 (SNG 268-9, 388) â€ Vlasto, NC 1926, pp. 162, 166, 211-8, illus. Stazio, AIIN 1965-7, pp. 54-5 In addition to above, Vlasto Cat. notes as from this hd. nos. 855-7, 919-23 (Per. VIII) and 961 (Per. IX). For 919-23 see no. 1984 below, for 961 see no. 2006; 855-7 could derive from either no. 2000 or no. 1998
